markings:
\"Ibarakiya\", the name of the house that the courtesan seemes to belong to is shown on the red banner, which also suggests that this scene is a \"mitate\" of the famous story at Rashomon gate. 
The emblem seen on the man\'s umbrella suggests that the man is likened to Watanabe no Tsuna.
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: First state. Second state has the characters Ibaraki no longer outlined in black.
title: Prostitute and Customer at the Ibarakiya; Visual Parody of Watanabe Tsuna and the Ibaraki Demon
